results.title: Flacourtia indica fruit extract modulated antioxidant gene expression, prevented oxidative stress and ameliorated kidney dysfunction in isoprenaline administered rats
results.text_hl: Moreover, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and Flacourtia indica fruit extract also modulated the genes expressions related to @<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@ and oxidative stress in kidneys.

citations.NLM: Selim S, Akter N, Nayan SI, Chowdhury FI, Saffoon N, Khan F, Ahmed KS, Ahmed MI, Hossain MM, Alam MA. Flacourtia indica fruit extract modulated antioxidant gene expression, prevented oxidative stress and ameliorated kidney dysfunction in isoprenaline administered rats Biochem Biophys Rep. 2021 Jul;26():101012. PMID: 34041370

results.title: Medications for Hypertension Change the Secretome Profile from Marrow Stromal Cells and Peripheral Blood Monocytes
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ increased @GENE_IL1RN @GENE_3557 @@@IL-1RA@@@ in @DISEASE_Stroke @DISEASE_MESH:D020521 @@@stroke@@@-Mo and decreased @GENE_CXCL8 @GENE_3576 @@@IL-8@@@ secretion from MSCs indicating an anti-@<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ on secretomes of these cells.

citations.NLM: Satani N, Giridhar K, Cai C, Wewior N, Norris DD, Aronowski J, Savitz SI. Medications for Hypertension Change the Secretome Profile from Marrow Stromal Cells and Peripheral Blood Monocytes Stem Cells Int. 2020;2020():8894168. PMID: 32802081

results.title: Effects of selective beta1-adrenoceptor blockade on cardiovascular and renal function and circulating cytokines in ovine hyperdynamic sepsis
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ appears safe in @DISEASE_Sepsis @DISEASE_MESH:D018805 @@@sepsis@@@, has no deleterious cardiovascular or renal effects, and has an anti-@<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ effect.

citations.NLM: Calzavacca P, Lankadeva YR, Bailey SR, Bailey M, Bellomo R, May CN. Effects of selective beta1-adrenoceptor blockade on cardiovascular and renal function and circulating cytokines in ovine hyperdynamic sepsis Crit Care. 2014 Nov 21;18(6):610. PMID: 25413250

results.title: Influence of inflammatory disease on the clinical pharmacokinetics of atenolol and metoprolol.

results.title: Inhibition of inflammation contributes to organ protection of atenolol in sinoaortic-denervated rats.
results.text_hl: Inhibition of @<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@ contributes to organ protection of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in sinoaortic-denervated @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

results.title: CNS penetration of small molecules following local inflammation, widespread systemic inflammation or direct injury to the nervous system.
results.text_hl: Systemic @<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammation@@@ increased the quantity of @CHEMICAL_Evans_Blue @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005070 @@@Evans blue@@@ in the CNS but also decreased the penetration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Morphine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009020 @@@morphine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Oxycodone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010098 @@@oxycodone@@@ into the brain 4-hr post-insult.

citations.NLM: Lu P, Gonzales C, Chen Y, Adedoyin A, Hummel M, Kennedy JD, Whiteside GT. CNS penetration of small molecules following local inflammation, widespread systemic inflammation or direct injury to the nervous system. Life Sci. 2009 Sep 9;85(11-12):450-6. PMID: 19632245

results.title: Increased inflammatory biomarkers in hypertensive type 2 diabetic patients: improvement after angiotensin II type 1 receptor blockade.
results.text_hl: We tested the hypothesis that in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes@@@, blood pressure (BP) reduction with an angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB), @CHEMICAL_Valsartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068756 @@@valsartan@@@, or with a beta blocker, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, is associated with a decreased @<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ response.

citations.NLM: Touyz RM, Savoia C, He Y, Endemann D, Pu Q, Ko EA, Deciuceis C, Montezano A, Schiffrin EL. Increased inflammatory biomarkers in hypertensive type 2 diabetic patients: improvement after angiotensin II type 1 receptor blockade. J Am Soc Hypertens. 2007 May-Jun;1(3):189-99. PMID: 20409851

results.title: Effect of atenolol pre-treatment in heart damage in a model of intestinal ischemia-reperfusion.
results.text_hl: PURPOSE: To investigate the effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ mediator and oxidative stress in a @DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@myocardial injury@@@ by intestinal @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@/reperfusion in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ model.

results.title: Ischemic preconditioning and atenolol on lung injury after intestinal ischemia and reperfusion in rats.
results.text_hl: Histologic analysis showed an important @<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ infiltrate in the I-R + SS (I-R + SS = 4.5), which was significantly (P < .05) reduced by IPC (I-R + IPC = 3.0) or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@AT@@@ (I-R + @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@AT@@@ = 3.0).

citations.NLM: Bonservizi WG, Koike MK, Saurim R, Felix GA, da Silva SM, Montero EF, Taha MO. Ischemic preconditioning and atenolol on lung injury after intestinal ischemia and reperfusion in rats. Transplant Proc. 2014 Jul-Aug;46(6):1862-6. PMID: 25131055

results.title: PHARMACOLOGIC TREATMENT OF HYPERALGESIA EXPERIMENTALLY INDUCED BY NUCLEUS PULPOSUS
results.text_hl: Objective: To evaluate the effect of anti-@<m>DISEASE_Inflammation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ drugs (@CHEMICAL_Dexamethasone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003907 @@@dexamethasone@@@, @CHEMICAL_Indomethacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007213 @@@indomethacin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Indomethacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007213 @@@indomethacin@@@ plus @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@) and analgesic drugs (@CHEMICAL_Morphine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009020 @@@morphine@@@) on @DISEASE_Hyperalgesia @DISEASE_MESH:D006930 @@@hyperalgesia@@@ experimentally induced by the @DISEASE_Fibrocartilaginous_embolism @DISEASE_MESH:C537927 @@@nucleus pulposus@@@ (@DISEASE_Fibrocartilaginous_embolism @DISEASE_MESH:C537927 @@@NP@@@) in contact with the L5 dorsal root ganglion (DRG).

citations.NLM: de Souza Grava AL, Ferrari LF, Parada CA, Defino HL. PHARMACOLOGIC TREATMENT OF HYPERALGESIA EXPERIMENTALLY INDUCED BY NUCLEUS PULPOSUS Rev Bras Ortop. 2010 Nov-Dec;45(6):569-76. PMID: 27026966
